result.execSummary:
All charges against Naihla L. Buckley in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Naihla L. Buckley is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Naihla L. Buckley
Current: 800 Minnehaha Ave E Suite 250 & 445, Nivon Wellness Center, Saint Paul, MN 55106 United States  (Effective: 09-06-2022)
Prior: 708 N. Main Street P.O. Box 781, River Falls, WI 54022

8:19 AM Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: V. Kasten, Clerk: B Harris, Defendant Naihla L. Buckley in court, in custody.  Attorney Jeremiah James Harrelson in court for Naihla L. Buckley.  Attorney Erica Ellenwood in court for State of Wisconsin.  Includes 21CF694, 21CF795, 21CF858, 21CF900, 21CM458, 22CF67, 22CF224, 22CF248.  Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads NC to Ct 1- Possession of Methamphetamine in 21CF858, NC to Ct 1- Battery or Threat to Judge, Prosecutor, or Law Enforcement Officer in 21CF900, & NC to Ct 1- Battery or Threat to Judge, Prosecutor, or Law Enforcement Officer in 22CF67.  DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 1 in files 21CF858, 21CF900, & 22CF67. On motion of the State without objection, Crt dismisses Ct 2 in 21CF858, Ct 2-5 in 21CF900, Ct 2-5 in 22CF67, 21CF694, 21CF795, 21CM458, 22CF224 & 22CF248 with prejudice.  Bond money on file is on cases 21CM458, 22CF67, & 22CF224. Sentencing arguments. Court reserves on credit, attorneys to update the Court by 9/7/22.  

Court Orders: Ct 1- 21CF858

S/W 3 Years  Probation is concurrent on all counts without prejudice to consecutive sentencing in the event of Probation revocation. 

- Court Costs: $268.00  
- DNA Sample and Surcharge: $250.00
Apply Bond. Balance to be pd through probation

Court Orders: Ct 1- 21CF900

S/W 3 Years  Probation is concurrent on all counts without prejudice to consecutive sentencing in the event of Probation revocation. 

- Court Costs: $268.00     
- DNA Sample and Surcharge: $250.00
Apply Bond. Balance to be pd through probation

Court Orders: Ct 1- 22CF67

S/W 3 Years  Probation is concurrent on all counts without prejudice to consecutive sentencing in the event of Probation revocation. 

- Court Costs: $268.00     
- DNA Sample and Surcharge: $250.00
Apply Bond. Balance to be pd through probation

Conditions of Probation:

- Complete mental health evaluation and follow through
- AODA and follow through 
- Test randomly and regularly 
- Absolute sobriety
- Apology letters to Officer J. Hemker and Sgt L. Dohmeier
- Pay supervision fees
- Sign up for probation today 9/6/22, DE to be taken to treatment program immediately after signing up for probation, no stops along the way. 

Adjourned at 9:13 AM 

Back on record at 9:45 AM- DE can not get into treatment until tomorrow 9/7/22, DE to be held in custody until tomorrow, sign up for probation and immediately report to treatment program.  No stops along the way. Adjourned at 9:46 AM. bph

11:10  AM Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: K Kittel.   ADA:   Erica Ellenwood w/Matthew Connor Smith   DF ATTY:  Jeremiah James Harrelson   DF:  Naihla L. Buckley appeared from jail.  INCLUDES:  21CF694, 21CF795, 21CF858, 21CF900, 21CM458, 22CF67. Atty Harrelson states parties are discussing settlement, DE has applied to a residential treatment program, could complete intake at facility if provided transportation as early as 6/2. Atty Ellenwood is hesitant to modify a bond. Court will take up bond at next hearing. If not a plea, will set for trial. Court notes K. Rheingans in court and makes statements on DE's behalf. Case also calls 22CF224 and 22CF248 that had been set with Branch IV today. Adjourned:  11:21 am  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 17, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 17, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Status conference on June 1, 2022 at 11:00 am.

CO: RMW , REP: Melstrom, CLERK: Liddle ADA: Erica Ellenwood   DF ATTY:  Jeremiah James Harrelson   DF:  Naihla L. Buckley appeared from jail. Case called at 3:33 p.m. Court notes this matter is set for a status conference. Atty Harrelson is working towards negotiations. Is waiting for additional reports from Investigator. Court schedules. Atty Harrelson requesting matter be set in Branch 3 for scheduling purposes only. Court adjourned at 3:37 p.m.  Status conference scheduled for June 1, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Status conference on May 11, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

CO: RMW , REP: Melstrom, CLERK: Liddle ADA:   Erica Ellenwood   DF ATTY:  Jeremiah James Harrelson   DF:  Naihla L. Buckley appeared from jail. Case called at 11:08 a.m. Court notes this matter is set for a preliminary hearing. ADA Ellenwood calls Officer Walker to the Stand. S/T James Walker. Employed with the City of River Falls Police Department. Direct by ADA Ellenwood. Witness identifies DE in the courtroom. Record will reflect identification. Cross by Atty Harrelson. Witness excused. No further evidence or witnesses by either party. ADA Ellenwood requesting Court take judicial notice of bonds in 22CF67 and 21CM458. Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the DF probably committed that felony and binds over for trial. ADA Ellenwood will file an information to mirror complaint. Atty Harrelson will proceed to arraignment. Enters NG plea to all counts. Does not demand a speedy trial. Needs time to review discovery and will speak with ADA regarding a possible global resolution. Court will hear all matters if there is a global resolution if approved by other Branches. Court adjourned at 11:25 a.m.  Status conference scheduled for May 11, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Appointing Atty Harrelson. Filed by Atty Harrelson. arc
Filed by Atty Harrelson. arc   e:DA

records.addlTxt: Preliminary hearing on April 19, 2022 at 11:00 am.

CO: RMW , REP: Melstrom, CLERK: Liddle ADA:   Michael Joseph Becker   DF ATTY:  Abrianna Dolfi   DF:  Naihla L. Buckley appeared from jail via video. DE has a copy of complaint. Homeless. Does not understand charges and penalties. Atty Dolfi waives further reading. Qualifies for PD services. ADA Becker states per JSC representative, treatment has been turned down by DE. Also she is not complying with GPS conditions on other bond. Court if treatment is arranged, would be willing to revisit bond. Atty Harrelson is appointed on other files.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 19, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Initial appearance on April 7, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

CO: RMW , REP: Melstrom, CLERK: Liddle ADA:  Michael Joseph Becker   DF ATTY: Kaitlin Dippolito and  Jeremiah James Harrelson   DF:  Naihla L. Buckley refused appearance. OFF RECORD. Court resets for tomorrow.  Initial appearance scheduled for April 7, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
